SignacX 2.2.4

Get the most out of your single cell data.
Explore the website »

View Demo · Report Bug · Request Feature

What is SignacX?

SignacX is software developed and maintained by the Savova lab at Sanofi with a focus on single cell genomics for clinical applications. SignacX classifies the cellular phenotype for each individual cell in single cell RNA-sequencing data using neural networks trained with sorted bulk gene expression data from the Human Primary Cell Atlas. To learn more, check out the pre-print, website and code base. You can install SignacX from CRAN by running:

install.packages("SignacX")
library(SignacX)
